items.sentence: A taxi from the airport costs around thirty dollars.
After his father died, Tom started drinking heavily.
All of my great-grandparents died before I was born.
I can\'t get anything done if you keep bothering me.
Is this the reason you didn\'t want to come with me?
If I remember correctly, Tom used to be a carpenter.
Tom didn\'t know Mary thought he shouldn\'t do that.
Let me tell you the reason I don\'t want to do that.
Let\'s leave things as they are until he comes back.
My parents don\'t want me drinking beer every night.
What I wanted to drink was white wine, not red wine.
What Tom really wanted to eat was chocolate pudding.
Do you need a license to use an electric wheelchair?
I wish you luck in finding what you\'re looking for.
I ate dinner last night, but I don\'t think Tom did.
I borrowed my father\'s hammer to build a dog house.
Tom is staying at the same hotel where I\'m staying.
Tom says that he\'s going to go to Boston with Mary.
I didn\'t know Tom didn\'t have a driver\'s license.
I recognized Tom as soon as he walked into the room.
